citation.article-title: Alkaliphilic heliobacterium Heliorestis baculata sp. nov. and emended description of the genus Heliorestis.

p.s: Emended description of the genus Heliorestis
Heliorestis (He.li.o.res'tis. Gr. n. helios sun; L. fem. n. restis rope; M. L. fem. n. Heliorestis a solar rope)
Cells are either tight coils or bent filaments, or rods, straight or slightly curved.
Stain gram-negatively, but lack an outer membrane.
Contain bacteriochlorophyll g and neurosporene-like carotenoid pigments, but lack intracytoplasmic membranes or chlorosomes.
Obligately anaerobic; grow photoheterotrophically on a limited range of organic carbon sources.
Development is dependent on the presence of carbonate ions.
Phylogenetic position within the heliobacterial clade of the low G+C gram-positive bacteria, but basal to the genera Heliobacterium, Heliobacillus, and Heliophilum.
Habitat: alkaline soils and soda lakes.
The type species of the genus is Heliorestis daurensis.
